intro: Henckelia missionis, commonly known as the Mission Island dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, coastal habitats. The plant features basal rosettes of silver-green leaves and produces yellow composite flowers. Its flowers are followed by fluffy white seed heads, which are adapted for wind dispersal. Henckelia missionis is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
